results.title: Leonardo da Vinci and his art
results.brief_description: Intersperses Leonardo’s drawings, workbook sketches, studies and paintings with scenes of Florence, the village of Vinci and the landscape of Tuscany. Examines a number of his paintings in detail, revealing the special quality of the artist’s work.

results.title: Leonard French's stained glass screens [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Michael Thornhill
results.brief_description: The National Library in Canberra is the repository of some of the most distinguished works of art in Australia. Among them is a set of twelve stained glass screens executed by painter Leonard French. Taking as his theme the planets, French designed a set of screens which drew on the craggy beauty of medieval stained glass for their inspiration. In Italian language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Michael Thornhill

results.brief_description: A boy and his harmonica save the day. Definitive illustrations give full dimension to each character and represent delightful vignettes of a typical American town. Based on the book by Robert McCloskey.

results.title: Lenses and perspective: how does it look from where you are?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Lays to rest the mistaken idea that focal length affects the appearance of depth. Demonstrates that the camera-to-subject distance is the governing factor in the perception of spatial relationships in the third dimension. Devised and narrated by Peter Thompson.

results.title: Lenses
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, S.G. Fergusson, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Light”.
Convex lens as a collection of prism sections; images formed by convex lens; applications of the various object/image arrangement; effect of increased curvature; concave lens; images formed by a concave lens.

results.title: Lenses
results.brief_description: Explains phases of lense refraction, and by animation shows action of a converging lense, real and virtual images, changes of magnification; effect of a diverging lense, and formation of the virtual image; and construction of achromatic lenses. Silent film with English subtext.
results.description: Explains phases of lense refraction, and by animation shows action of a converging lense, real and virtual images, changes of magnification; effect of a diverging lense, and formation of the virtual image; and construction of achromatic lenses. Silent film with English subtext.

results.title: Lennon: a tribute
results.creator_credit: Philip Chilvers, Ian Bolt, John Lennon Tribute Ltd and Gavin Taylor
results.brief_description: John Lennon was one of the most talented and prolific songwriters of our time. His music is as timeless and relevant today as it was a generation ago. His songs revolutionised our music and culture. In this unique tribute to Lennon, over 23 of the world’s greatest performers bring a little bit of magic to Lennon’s songs as they perform their own interpretations of his classics. From Lenny Kravitz singing “Cold Turkey” to Hall and Oates singing “Don’t let me down” to Elton John performing “Imagine” we are moved by the strength of the emotions Lennon’s words still evoke today. Hosted by Michael Douglas, these memorable songs are intercut with rare archival footage of John Lennon and The Beatles.

results.title: Lenin and Trotsky
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Shows how Lenin and Trotsky made possible the seizure of the Russian Government and the consolidation of Communist power in the USSR, and how Lenin became a Communist hero, while Trotsky became the arch-enemy. Suitable for upper secondary level.
